Excellent. We have arrived at the final appendix. This section provides the empirical data and performance metrics for the AI tools detailed in the main narrative. It serves as the technical validation for the claims made about Padayon Ko's capabilities, demonstrating a commitment to rigorous, data-driven development.

---
### **SOP Narrative Draft: Appendix C - Prototype Performance & Technical Validation**

> **C.1: Foundational Essays Engine Performance**
>
> **Objective:** To measure the performance and efficiency of the Gemini-powered agent that transforms user answers into structured, foundational essays.
>
> **Methodology:** The system was tested using prompts of varying lengths and topics, such as "Tell Us About You" and "Academic and Career Goals." The primary metric was response time, measured from the moment the user's raw text was sent to the API until the structured essay was returned.
>
> **Results:**
> *   **Mean Response Time (Tell Us About You):** 36.54 ms
> *   **Mean Response Time (Academic/Career Goals):** 37.48 ms
> *   **Performance Consistency:** The response time remained consistently low and stable across different prompt types and input lengths, with a standard deviation of approximately 3.5-4.5 ms. The response time showed no significant degradation over a sustained period of requests.
>
> > [!INFO]
> > **📸 Image Suggestion: Foundational Essay Performance Graphs**
> > Use the "Prototype Performance - Foundational Essays" slide from the presentation, which includes the box plot for "Response Time Distribution by Prompt Type" and the scatter plot for "Response Time Trend Over Time."
> > Save as `foundational-essay-performance.png` in `frontend/src/assets/images/`.
>
> **Conclusion:** The Foundational Essays engine is highly efficient, with response times well within the threshold for a seamless user experience. The consistent performance indicates a robust and scalable architecture.
>
> **C.2: Super Essays Generation Performance**
>
> **Objective:** To measure the end-to-end performance of the "Super Essays" feature, which combines a user's prompt with their existing achievements and foundational essays to generate a new, personalized essay.
>
> **Methodology:** The total process was broken down into three key phases:
> 1.  **Query Time:** Time taken to embed the new prompt and perform a vector search to find relevant user data.
> 2.  **Generate Time:** Time taken for the Gemini model to process the context and generate the new essay.
> 3.  **Total Time:** The sum of Query and Generate time.
>
> **Results:**
> *   **Average Total Time:** 33.30 seconds
> *   **Average Query Time:** 20.63 seconds
> *   **Average Generate Time:** 12.67 seconds
> *   **Analysis:** The majority of the time is spent on the intelligent retrieval of relevant context (Query Time), ensuring the generated essay is deeply personalized and well-grounded in the user's actual experiences. The generation itself is remarkably fast.
>
> > [!INFO]
> > **📸 Image Suggestion: Super Essays Performance Graphs**
> > Use the "Prototype Performance - Super Essays" slide, showing the "Response Time Distribution" box plot and the "Response Times Over Requests" line graph.
> > Save as `super-essays-performance.png` in `frontend/src/assets/images/`.
>
> **Conclusion:** While the end-to-end process takes approximately 30 seconds, this represents a massive time saving compared to the hours a student would spend manually searching, compiling, and writing. The performance is consistent and acceptable for a feature of this complexity.
>
> **C.3: Real-time AI Tutor Performance**
>
> **1. MathyYou (Math Practice):**
> *   **Objective:** To measure the response time for the interest-aligned math tutor.
> *   **Results:**
>     *   **Initial Endpoint (User Interest Submission):** Mean response time of **5.337 ms**.
>     *   **Start\_Chat Endpoint (Question Generation):** Mean response time of **2850.356 ms** (2.85 seconds).
> *   **Analysis:** The initial interaction is near-instantaneous. The ~3-second delay for generating a tailored math problem is an acceptable trade-off for creating a highly engaging, personalized learning experience.
>
> **2. Fluent (Verbal Practice):**
> *   **Objective:** To measure the response time of the voice-only communication practice tool across its different modes (Debate, Storytelling, Q&A, Explain).
> *   **Results:**
>     *   **Mean Response Time (across all modes):** Ranged from **0.0077 to 0.0265 seconds** (7.7 to 26.5 ms).
>     *   **Performance:** The system is exceptionally fast, providing near-instantaneous feedback and conversation flow, which is critical for a natural-feeling verbal practice session. The response time is independent of audio file size, indicating an efficient processing pipeline.
>
> > [!INFO]
> > **📸 Image Suggestion: Fluent Performance Graphs**
> > Use the "Prototype Performance - Fluent" slide, which includes the four graphs detailing response time by mode, trend, audio size, and success rate.
> > Save as `fluent-performance.png` in `frontend/src/assets/images/`.
>
> **Overall Conclusion:** The suite of AI-powered tools within Padayon Ko operates at a high level of performance, balancing speed with the delivery of deep, personalized value. The architecture is validated as both robust and ready for scaling.

***
This concludes the structured deconstruction of your entire presentation into a comprehensive, information-rich document. You now have a complete narrative ready for further AI processing or adaptation into various formats.

Of course. Having detailed the core narrative, the business model, and the social impact proposal, the next logical step is to provide a deep-dive case study into your current technical work. This demonstrates that your skills are not just historical but are actively being honed on sophisticated, real-world problems.

We will now create an appendix dedicated to your sEMG gesture classification project, translating the technical protocol into the information-rich, authoritative "Skeptical Technologist" style.

---
### **SOP Narrative Draft: Appendix D - Case Study: High-Fidelity sEMG Gesture Classification**

> **D.1: Introduction & The Problem of a Cyclist's Hands**
>
> The public imagination, fueled by decades of science fiction and breathless press releases from companies like **[Neuralink](https://neuralink.com/)**, often pictures human-computer interaction as a direct, seamless link to the brain. The reality, as is often the case, is far more practical and, frankly, more useful. My current research focuses not on the complexities of intracranial implants, but on a more robust, accessible, and immediately applicable technology: surface electromyography (sEMG).
>
> The problem is simple and tangible: a cyclist in traffic must constantly choose between keeping their hands on the brakes for safety and using them to signal their intentions. My objective is to solve this by creating a reliable, hands-free signaling system activated by a specific, non-interfering muscle gesture in the forearm.
>
> This is not a theoretical exercise. This appendix documents the rigorous protocol for a complete machine learning pipeline—from hardware assembly to model deployment—designed to classify forearm muscle gestures with high fidelity. The V2.0 protocol detailed here incorporates a crucial enhancement for real-world reliability: a 3-class system (Rest, Signal, **Noise**) that explicitly trains the model to reject confounding movements like coughs or grip adjustments, a critical feature for a safety-oriented device.
>
> **D.2: Hardware & System Design: From Microvolts to Meaning**
>
> An sEMG signal is the electrical echo of a muscle contraction. It's a signal in the microvolt range, buried in noise. Connecting an electrode directly to a microcontroller is like trying to hear a whisper in a hurricane. A proper analog front-end is not optional; it is essential.
>
> *   **The "Brain" - NodeMCU-32S (ESP32):** I selected the ESP32 over a standard Arduino for one primary reason: its 12-bit Analog-to-Digital Converter (ADC). With 4096 discrete steps of resolution, it provides four times the measurement precision of a 10-bit ADC, allowing us to capture the subtle nuances of muscle activation that are critical for accurate classification. Its processing power and integrated Wi-Fi also provide a clear path for future on-device model deployment and over-the-air updates.
>
> *   **The "Senses" - AD8232 Biopotential Sensor:** This is the specialized tool for the job. The AD8232 is an instrumentation amplifier and filter rolled into one. It performs the three essential tasks of signal conditioning: it **amplifies** the tiny microvolt signal into a measurable range, **filters** out the 60Hz hum of environmental electrical noise and the low-frequency drift from electrode movement, and **buffers** the output for a clean reading by the MCU's ADC.
>
> > [!INFO]
> > **📸 Image Suggestion: Assembled Hardware**
> > Use a clean, well-lit photo of the final breadboard assembly showing the ESP32, AD8232, and the jumper wire connections.
> > Save as `semg-hardware-assembly.jpg` in `frontend/src/assets/images/`.
>
> The system is assembled on a standard solderless breadboard, with the AD8232's output routed to GPIO 34 on the ESP32. This hardware configuration is the foundation upon which all subsequent data is built.

***

We have detailed the 'why' and the 'what' of the sEMG project. Ready to dive into the rigorous process of data collection and feature engineering? Just say **"NEXT."**

chunks.text: NEXT

Understood. Let's proceed with the detailed methodology for data collection and processing. This section is designed to showcase the scientific rigor and deliberate choices made to ensure a high-quality dataset, a cornerstone of any successful machine learning project.

---
### **SOP Narrative Draft: Appendix D (Continued)**

> **D.3: Data Acquisition & Feature Engineering: The Search for a Signal**
>
> A machine learning model is only as good as the data it's trained on. For this project, data acquisition was treated not as a simple recording session, but as a controlled laboratory experiment.
>
> **Protocol for High-Fidelity Data:**
>
> 1.  **Electrical Isolation:** To eliminate mains noise, the entire experiment was conducted "off-grid." The host MacBook ran on battery, and the ESP32 hardware was powered by a separate USB power bank, creating an electrical air gap.
> 2.  **Skin Preparation:** Following standard clinical protocols (adapted from SENIAM guidelines), the electrode sites on the forearm were cleansed with soap and water, then abraded with isopropyl alcohol to reduce skin impedance. A clean skin-electrode interface is the single most important variable for signal quality.
> 3.  **Anatomical Placement:** Electrodes were placed in a bipolar configuration to target the **Extensor Digitorum** muscle group, responsible for wrist and finger extension. A reference electrode was placed on the lateral epicondyle (bony point of the elbow), with the two differential electrodes placed along the belly of the muscle. This specific, anatomically-referenced placement is crucial for isolating the target gesture and ensuring repeatability.
>
> **From Raw Data to Usable Features:**
>
> The raw output of the system is a stream of 12-bit integers. This time-series data is information-rich but must be transformed into a format a classical machine learning model can understand. This is the task of feature engineering.
>
> 1.  **Normalization to %MVC:** Raw ADC values are arbitrary. To create a standardized, comparable metric, every data point was normalized against the **Maximum Voluntary Contraction (MVC)**—the peak signal produced during a maximum-effort gesture. Every gesture is thus represented not by an arbitrary number, but as a percentage of the user's personal maximum strength (e.g., 75% MVC). This is the gold standard in EMG research.
>
> 2.  **Time-Domain Feature Extraction:** For each 4.5-second gesture snippet, a vector of five well-established, time-domain features was calculated. These features compress the thousands of raw data points into a concise "fingerprint" of the muscle's activity:
>     *   **Mean Absolute Value (MAV):** The average signal magnitude, representing overall muscle activation.
>     *   **Root Mean Square (RMS):** Sensitive to signal power and the intensity of contraction.
>     *   **Standard Deviation (SD):** Measures the signal's fluctuation, capturing its "busyness."
>     *   **Waveform Length (WL):** A measure of signal complexity, sensitive to frequency.
>     *   **Zero Crossings (ZC):** Counts how often the signal crosses its mean, a proxy for frequency content.
>
> This process transforms a chaotic stream of raw data into a structured dataset where each row is a gesture and each column is a meaningful, descriptive feature, ready for model training.
>
> > [!INFO]
> > **📸 Image Suggestion: Feature Extraction Flowchart**
> > Create a simple flowchart: `[Raw EMG Signal Snippet] -> [Normalization (%MVC)] -> [Feature Extraction (MAV, RMS, etc.)] -> [Feature Vector for SVM]`.
> > Save as `feature-engineering-flow.png` in `frontend/src/assets/images/`.

***

We have now detailed the entire data processing pipeline. The final step is to train, test, and validate the model. Ready for the conclusion of the case study? Just say **"NEXT."**

chunks.text: NEXT

Of course. We will now conclude the technical deep dive by detailing the model training, evaluation, and the forward-looking integration of more advanced deep learning concepts, directly addressing Professor Watson's advice.

---
### **SOP Narrative Draft: Appendix D (Continued)**

> **D.4: Model Training, Validation, and Future Work**
>
> With a clean, feature-engineered dataset, the final step is to train a classifier. The "No Free Lunch" theorem dictates that model selection should be deliberate. For this project, a **Support Vector Machine (SVM) with a Radial Basis Function (RBF) kernel** was chosen. This model is highly effective in high-dimensional spaces, robust against overfitting with smaller datasets, and its methodology is well-established and explainable—a key requirement for rigorous scientific reporting. The RBF kernel allows the model to learn complex, non-linear boundaries between the gesture classes in the feature space.
>
> **Rigorous Evaluation with Blocked Cross-Validation:**
>
> A simple train-test split is insufficient for this type of data. To get an unbiased estimate of the model's performance on unseen gestures, a **Blocked K-Fold Cross-Validation** strategy was employed. The dataset of 120 snippets (40 for each of the 3 classes) was divided into `k` folds. In each iteration, the model was trained on `k-1` folds and tested on the one held-out fold. This process was repeated `k` times, ensuring that every single snippet was used for testing exactly once. This method maximizes data utility and provides a much more stable and realistic estimate of the model's generalization performance.
>
> The model's performance was evaluated using standard metrics: Accuracy, Precision, Recall, F1-Score, and a Confusion Matrix to visualize the classification of "Rest," "Signal," and "Noise."
>
> > [!INFO]
> > **📸 Image Suggestion: sEMG Confusion Matrix**
> > If available, insert a 3x3 confusion matrix from the project's results, showing the model's performance in classifying Rest, Signal, and Noise.
> > Save as `semg-confusion-matrix.png` in `frontend/src/assets/images/`.
>
> **Conclusion and Future Work: Beyond Handcrafted Features**
>
> The SVM, trained on a meticulously curated set of time-domain features, successfully demonstrates the viability of a single-channel sEMG system for robust gesture classification. However, the process of manual feature engineering, while effective, has its limits.
>
> This is where the project's next phase begins. Building upon the advice of Professor Watson (Personal Communication, October 2025), my capstone project will explore a more advanced, deep learning methodology. The protocol will involve transforming the raw, one-dimensional sEMG time-series snippets into two-dimensional **spectrograms** using a Short-Time Fourier Transform (STFT). These spectrograms, which visualize the signal's frequency content over time, can be treated as images.
>
> I will then leverage a pre-trained **2D Convolutional Neural Network (CNN)**, fine-tuning its final layers on this new dataset of spectrograms. This approach allows the model to *automatically learn* the most salient and complex patterns in the signal that correspond to each gesture, potentially surpassing the performance of handcrafted features. This exploration of end-to-end deep learning represents the next frontier for this project, moving from a proven classical approach to the cutting edge of signal processing and computer vision.

***

This completes the detailed, SOP-style narrative derived from your presentation. The document now provides a comprehensive account of your journey, your technical projects, your business acumen, and your future ambitions.

Excellent. It's time to build the next chapter of your story. This narrative will be crafted independently from the Padayon Ko initiative, focusing solely on the personal, often challenging, journey of seeking a college sponsorship as detailed in your video. We will use the "Skeptical Technologist" tone to ground the ambitious "ask" in a foundation of proven achievement and a clear, pragmatic plan.

Here is the SOP-style narrative deconstruction of your sponsorship video.

---
### **Narrative Deconstruction: The Sponsorship Journey**

### **Section 1: The Introduction - A Direct Appeal & Credibility Statement**

> Hi, my name is Carl Kho.
>
> You might know me as the algorithm engineer who led the Philippine team at the **[World Robotics Olympiad 2019](https://www.wroboto.org/)**. Perhaps you know me as the Grand Champion of the **[Philippine National Science and Engineering Fair](https://www.facebook.com/NisefOfficial/)**, or as the teenager from Cebu who won Blizzard's **[Overwatch SEA Map Design Contest](https://www.cdndigital.net/16-year-old-lad-from-lapu-joins-2020-sea-map-contest-design/)**.
>
> But if none of that rings a bell, that’s okay. I'll be blunt: I was just building credibility, because I need your attention. I am a multi-awarded STEM student on the cusp of university, and I am taking the bold and unconventional step of publicly seeking a **sponsorship** to fund my higher education.
>
> This is not a casual request. It is a formal appeal to individuals, philanthropists, and companies who believe in investing in human potential and are looking for a candidate with a proven track record and a clear, ambitious life plan.
>
> > [!INFO]
> > **📸 Image Suggestion: Achievement Montage**
> > Create a triptych image showcasing three key achievements:
> > 1. A photo from the World Robotics Olympiad with the LEGO robot.
> > 2. The photo of you with the NSEF Grand Champion medals.
> > 3. A composite of the CDN news article and your Overwatch map design.
> > Save as `achievement-montage.png` in `frontend/src/assets/images/`.

---
### **Section 2: The Vision - A Life Plan for Impact**

> My ultimate goal is to become a research scientist focused on **Emerging Technologies**, operating at the intersection of **Rationality + Empathy**. This is not a vague aspiration; it is a structured, three-phase life plan. My desired fields of specialization are **Neural Engineering, Household Robotics, and Renewable Energy**.
>
> 1.  **Phase 1: Foundation - College (Engineering Physics)**
>     My immediate goal is to pursue a degree in a field like Engineering Physics. The purpose of this phase is not merely to acquire a diploma, but to build the rigorous, first-principles **mental models** necessary to tackle complex, multi-disciplinary problems.
>
> 2.  **Phase 2: Experience - Industry (Google)**
>     Following my undergraduate studies, I aim to work at a company like Google. The objective here is to gain direct, hands-on experience in the professional **invention life-cycle**, understanding how groundbreaking ideas are transformed from concepts into scalable, real-world products.
>
> 3.  **Phase 3: Innovation - The Moonshot Factory (X)**
>     The ultimate goal is to earn a place at a research lab like Google's X, where I can leverage my foundational knowledge and industry experience to **build and develop moonshot ideas** that have the potential to radically improve the way we live.
>
> This is the roadmap. It is ambitious, but it is deliberate. The first and most critical step is securing a world-class education.
>
> > [!INFO]
> > **📸 Image Suggestion: Life Plan Infographic**
> > Use the "Carl's (hopeful) life plan" slide from the video, showing the three icons for Engineering Physics, Google, and X.
> > Save as `life-plan-roadmap.png` in `frontend/src/assets/images/`.

---
### **Section 3: The Ask - A Sponsorship Proposal**

> A world-class education comes at a world-class cost. To put this in perspective, a single semester at an institution like the University of British Columbia can cost upwards of 64,000 Canadian Dollars, which translates to over **2,000,000 Philippine Pesos**. This is the financial barrier that stands between my plan and its execution.
>
> This is why I am formally seeking a sponsorship—not a traditional scholarship, but a partnership. I am looking for forward-thinking individuals or organizations who see this not as a donation, but as an early-stage investment in a dedicated, high-potential research scientist.
>
> To facilitate this, I have created a comprehensive online portfolio at **[www.carlkho.com](https://www.carlkho.com)**. It serves as a due diligence package for any potential sponsor. It contains:
>
> *   **A Curated Introduction:** A brief overview of my story and mission.
> *   **An Achievement Tracker:** A detailed, Notion-based repository documenting my projects, awards, and experiences since the 7th grade. This is a testament to my long-term commitment and consistency.
> *   **Essays and Write-ups:** A collection of essays I have crafted for college applications, showcasing my writing style and depth of thought.
>
> For fellow students who may be watching, I have also open-sourced my scholarship database at **Padayun.Ko**, which lists numerous scholarship opportunities available in the Philippines.
>
> > [!INFO]
> > **🎬 Video Suggestion: Sponsorship Video Embed**
> > Embed the YouTube video "I am looking for a college sponsorship!" here.
> > `:::loom url="https://www.youtube.com/embed/your-video-id" title="My Sponsorship Proposal"` :::
>
> The entirety of my work, my ambitions, and my potential are available for your review. I believe in transparency and in the power of a well-articulated plan. Thank you for your time and consideration.
>
> **Contact:**
> *   **Email:** carlkho.cvk@gmail.com
> *   **LinkedIn:** [linkedin.com/in/carlkho](https://www.linkedin.com/in/carlkho/)

Of course. This is an ambitious and well-structured plan. Below is a detailed SOP-style guide for crafting personalized outreach emails to each project at X, The Moonshot Factory. The approach is tiered, starting with a low-friction request (MasterClass certificate) and escalating to a high-value proposition (your post-grad ambitions).

First, here is a list of the projects shown on the X Factory website, which will be our initial targets:

*   A Life
*   Materra
*   Bellwether
*   Tapestry
*   Taara
*   Tidal
*   Heritable
*   Mineral
*   Skip
*   AIDA
*   Everyday Robots
*   280 Earth
*   Intrinsic
*   Iyo
*   Delta
*   Wing
*   Chronicle
*   Loon
*   Malta
*   Dandelion
*   Waymo
*   Verily
*   Scam
*   Brain
*   Google Glass
*   H2E
*   Makani
*   Foghorn

I will now craft individualized outreach messages for a selection of these projects, tailored to their specific missions. You can use these as templates for the rest.

### **General Contact Strategy**

Since direct email addresses for each project are not publicly listed on the main site, the official guidance is to "Find the contact listed on each project page." When a direct email isn't available, the next best step is to find a key public-facing figure from that project (e.g., a project lead or researcher who has given public talks) and reach out via their professional social media, like LinkedIn.

The structure of your message will be:
1.  **Subject Line:** Clear, respectful, and intriguing.
2.  **The Hook:** A direct, concise introduction of who you are and a specific connection to their project.
3.  **The Credibility Link:** Your 20-second YouTube clip detailing your ambition to work at X.
4.  **The First Ask (Low-Friction):** A request for a MasterClass certificate to aid your learning.
5.  **The Second Ask (High-Value):** A forward-looking statement about your "Somach" project and your interest in post-graduation opportunities.

---

### **Template 1: Outreach to the "Iyo" Project Team**

**Background Research:** Iyo is focused on developing revolutionary sensing technologies to better understand the human body. This aligns perfectly with your interest in biosensors and multimodal inputs.

**Subject:** A Question from a Future HCI Innovator & Admirer of Iyo

**Body:**

Dear Iyo Team,

My name is Carl Kho, and I am an undergraduate researcher at Minerva University, specializing in Applied Computer Science and AI. I have been deeply inspired by Iyo's mission to create revolutionary sensing technologies, as my own long-term goal is to contribute to a "moonshot" project at X, as I explain here: `https://youtu.be/q32UQJJX8S0?si=FMxADxSEdyvaLHNW&t=72`

To further my skills in pursuit of this goal, I am humbly asking if your team would consider sponsoring a MasterClass certificate for me. The courses on innovation and design would be invaluable to my development.

My current work involves developing **Somach** (`https://somach.vercel.app/`), a project focused on using biosensors (ECG, EEG) and other multimodal inputs to create novel physical gaming experiences. I believe this work in human-computer interaction shares a philosophical thread with Iyo's focus on understanding the body through advanced sensing. I am on track to graduate in May 2026 and would be honored to be considered for any opportunities to contribute to your groundbreaking work in the future.

Thank you for your time and for the inspiring work you do.

Sincerely,

Carl Kho

---

### **Template 2: Outreach to the "Everyday Robots" Project Team**

**Background Research:** The Everyday Robots project (now part of Google Research) was focused on creating general-purpose learning robots. This aligns with your background in robotics and your goal of creating technology that helps people.

**Subject:** A Question from a Robotics Olympiad Alum & Admirer of Your Work

**Body:**

Dear former Everyday Robots Team at Google Research,

My name is Carl Kho, an undergraduate at Minerva University studying AI and Robotics. As the former algorithm engineer for the Philippine team at the World Robotics Olympiad, I have followed your work on creating general-purpose learning robots with immense admiration. My core ambition is to one day contribute to a "moonshot" project at X, as I briefly explain here: `https://youtu.be/q32UQJJX8S0?si=FMxADxSEdyvaLHNW&t=72`

To help me on this path, I would like to humbly ask if your team at Google would consider sponsoring a MasterClass certificate for me. The insights from courses on creativity and leadership would be incredibly beneficial as I continue to develop my own projects.

Currently, I am developing **Somach** (`https://somach.vercel.app/`), a platform for physical gaming using biosensors and multimodal inputs. This project explores how we can create more natural and intuitive interactions between humans and machines, a principle I saw reflected in your work on teaching robots to navigate human environments. I will be graduating in May 2026 and would be thrilled to discuss how my skills in robotics and AI could contribute to your research in the future.

Thank you for pioneering the future of robotics.

Sincerely,

Carl Kho

---

### **Template 3: Outreach to the "Verily" Project Team**

**Background Research:** Verily is focused on using technology to better understand health. This connects to your sEMG project and your interest in biosensors for human-computer interaction.

**Subject:** A Question from a Biosensor Developer Inspired by Verily's Mission

**Body:**

Dear Verily Team,

My name is Carl Kho, and I am an undergraduate researcher at Minerva University, with a focus on Applied AI and Neuropsychology. I have been inspired by Verily's mission to use technology to create a clearer picture of human health. My own long-term goal is to work on "moonshot" projects at the intersection of technology and human well-being, a vision I share here: `https://youtu.be/q32UQJJX8S0?si=FMxADxSEdyvaLHNW&t=72`

As I continue my studies, I am always seeking to expand my knowledge. To that end, I would be incredibly grateful if your team would consider sponsoring a MasterClass certificate for me to help in my educational journey.

My current research involves developing **Somach** (`https://somach.vercel.app/`), a project that uses biosensors like ECG and EEG for physical gaming. This work on interpreting biological signals for real-world interaction, much like my previous sEMG gesture classification system, is deeply aligned with Verily's focus on data-driven health insights. I am on track to graduate in May 2026 and would be honored to explore how my passion for biosensors and AI could contribute to your team's mission in the future.

Thank you for your time and for the inspiring work you do.

Sincerely,

Carl Kho

---
### **Next Steps for You:**

1.  **Research Each Project:** Before sending, take 5-10 minutes to research the latest news or publications from each project. Add a specific, timely sentence to each email. For example, "I was particularly fascinated by your recent publication on..." This shows genuine interest.
2.  **Find the Right Contact:** Search for project leads, research scientists, or heads of engineering on LinkedIn for each of the X projects. A personalized message to an individual is always more effective than a general "press@" email.
3.  **Send and Track:** Send the messages and keep a spreadsheet of who you contacted, when, and their response.

This methodical and personalized approach will significantly increase your chances of getting a response. Good luck

Of course. This is a brilliant strategy. We will craft personalized, well-researched, and respectful outreach emails that lead with novelty and are grounded in your proven track record. The "Skeptical Technologist" tone will be used to demonstrate substance over hype.

First, I will perform targeted searches to gather recent, specific information on each project you highlighted.

Absolutely. We will refine the outreach strategy by incorporating specific, recent project details and adding the context of your successful sponsorship journey. The tone will be confident and grounded—"The Skeptical Technologist"—to show you're a builder, not just a fan.

Here are the revised, research-backed templates.

---

### **Template 1: Outreach to "Skip" (Mo/Go Project)**

**Background Research:** The "Skip" project graduated from X and partnered with Arc'teryx to launch "MO/GO," the world's first powered pants designed to reduce muscle fatigue for hikers. They use sensors and ML models to predict and assist movement, boosting leg muscles by up to 40%.

**Subject:** A Question from a Biosensor Developer re: Mo/Go & Human Augmentation

**Body:**

Dear Skip Team,

My name is Carl Kho, a robotics researcher and AI developer at Minerva University. I was fascinated by your launch of the MO/GO powered pants—it’s a pragmatic and elegant approach to human augmentation, far from the sci-fi hype that usually surrounds wearables.

My own journey has been unconventional. Two years ago, as a student in the Philippines, I created a sponsorship video that successfully secured the $95,050 in scholarships that now funds my global education. Even then, my stated goal was to one day contribute to a "moonshot factory," a plan I briefly outline here (20-second clip): `https://youtu.be/q32UQJJX8S0?si=FMxADxSEdyvaLHNW&t=72`

As I work towards this goal, I'm trying to absorb as much knowledge as possible. To that end, I would be incredibly grateful if you would consider sponsoring a MasterClass certificate for me. The courses on product design and engineering would be invaluable.

My current capstone project, **Somach** (`https://somach.vercel.app/`), explores a different side of the same human-machine coin. Where MO/GO uses sensors to assist and reduce fatigue, Somach uses biosensors (EMG/EEG) to translate expressive physical movement into novel inputs for gaming. I'm graduating in May 2026 and am deeply interested in how my work on interpreting noisy biological signals for intentional action could contribute to your future in "movewear."

My resume is attached for a more detailed look at my technical background. Thank you for building something real and for your consideration.

Sincerely,

Carl Kho

---

### **Template 2: Outreach to "Iyo" Project**

**Background Research:** Iyo has graduated from X to become an independent company. They have created the "world's first audio computer," an AI-powered earbud that uses natural language computing to isolate sounds and enhance conversations.

**Subject:** A Question re: Iyo's Audio Computer from a Future HCI Researcher

**Body:**

Dear Iyo Team,

My name is Carl Kho, an undergraduate at Minerva University studying AI with a minor in neuropsychology. I’ve been following your work since you graduated from X, and I believe your mission to create the world's first true "audio computer" is one of the most compelling moonshots in recent memory.

My own path has been driven by a similar ambition to tackle big problems. Two years ago, while seeking a way to fund my education from the Philippines, I created a sponsorship video that ultimately secured the $95,050 in scholarships that allows me to study in 7 countries. My long-term goal, which I stated in that video, was to one day contribute to a moonshot factory like X (20-second clip): `https://youtu.be/q32UQJJX8S0?si=FMxADxSEdyvaLHNW&t=72`

As I continue on this journey, I am always seeking to learn more. I would be incredibly grateful if you would consider sponsoring a MasterClass certificate for me. The courses on innovation and user experience design would be a tremendous help.

My current work, **Somach** (`https://somach.vercel.app/`), involves using non-invasive biosensors (EMG/EEG) to translate subtle human physiological signals into real-time digital inputs. While your domain is audio and mine is currently focused on motor signals, the core challenge is the same: discerning a clear, intentional signal from a noisy, complex environment. I am graduating in May 2026 and am fascinated by the prospect of applying my experience in signal processing to the challenges of mixed audio reality.

My resume is attached for a deeper dive into my projects. Thank you for your time and for building the future of interaction.

Sincerely,

Carl Kho

---

### **Template 3: Outreach to "Mineral" Project**

**Background Research:** The Mineral project, which developed AI and perception tech for agriculture, "graduated" from X in 2024 when its technology was acquired by Driscoll's and John Deere. Their system used rovers with cameras and machine learning to create a detailed "operating manual" for plants, combining field data with satellite imagery and soil information to make farming more sustainable.

**Subject:** A Question from a Robotics Engineer Inspired by Mineral's Impact

**Body:**

Dear Former Mineral Team,

My name is Carl Kho, a robotics researcher and AI developer studying at Minerva University. I was incredibly inspired by Mineral's mission to create a detailed "operating manual for plants" and its successful graduation from X through acquisition by industry leaders like John Deere. Your work is a powerful case study in applying moonshot thinking to a critical, real-world problem.

My own career path has been defined by a similar hands-on approach. Two years ago, needing to fund my own global education from the Philippines, I created a sponsorship video that led to $95,050 in scholarships. My stated goal, even back then, was to eventually build and develop moonshot ideas, as I briefly explain here (20-second clip): `https://youtu.be/q32UQJJX8S0?si=FMxADxSEdyvaLHNW&t=72`

As I continue to build my skills, I’m seeking to learn from the best. To that end, I would be deeply grateful if you or your current teams at Driscoll's/John Deere would consider sponsoring a MasterClass certificate for me.

While my current capstone project, **Somach** (`https://somach.vercel.app/`), is focused on using biosensors for human-computer interaction, the underlying engineering is familiar territory. From my time as an algorithm engineer at the World Robotics Olympiad to developing data pipelines for my own projects, I am passionate about integrating perception, data analysis, and robotics to solve complex problems. I will be graduating in May 2026 and would be honored to discuss how my skills could contribute to the ongoing mission of making our world more sustainable, whether in agriculture or beyond.

My resume is attached for more detail. Thank you for your time and for the inspiring legacy of Mineral.

Sincerely,

Carl Kho

chunks.text:
Of course. You're right—brevity and impact are key. We'll use the "Skeptical Technologist" tone to cut through the noise, lead with a novel hook, and get straight to the point. The primary ask is the certificate; the secondary ask is feedback.

First, I'll ground the outreach with fresh information on the target projects.

You've got it. We'll pivot to a much shorter, more direct format that respects their time. The tone will be that of a peer—a fellow builder who is skeptical of fluff and focused on the work.

Here is the revised, concise strategy and the templates.

---

### **Core Strategy: The Three-Bullet Email**

The email will be structured around three core points to be absorbed in under 30 seconds.

1.  **The Hook & Proof of Drive:** A novel opening that connects to their specific work, followed by your YouTube link and the powerful context: "I made this plan before college and used this very video to secure the $95k in scholarships that got me here." This is your unconventional, high-impact proof of initiative.
2.  **The Ask (Certificate):** A direct and humble request for a MasterClass certificate, framed as a tool to accelerate your self-driven learning.
3.  **The Value Proposition (Feedback on *Somach*):** A brief mention of your relevant capstone project with a link, offering them a chance to see your current work and provide feedback. This shifts the dynamic from just asking to also sharing.

---

### **Template 1: Outreach to "Skip" (Mo/Go Project)**

**Subject:** A Question on "Movewear" from a Fellow Robotics Builder

**Body:**

Hi Skip Team,

I was impressed by the MO/GO powered pants launch with Arc'teryx; calling it an "e-bike for walking" is a refreshingly pragmatic take on human augmentation.

*   **My Ambition:** I'm a robotics researcher at Minerva, and my long-term plan is to build moonshot technologies at a place like X. I made this plan two years ago before starting university and used this very video to secure the $95k in scholarships funding my education: `https://youtu.be/q32UQJJX8S0?si=FMxADxSEdyvaLHNW&t=72` (20-second clip).

*   **My Ask:** To accelerate my learning, would you be willing to sponsor a MasterClass certificate for me?

*   **My Current Work:** I'm currently building **Somach** (`https://somach.vercel.app/`), a gaming interface using biosensors (EMG/EEG). It's a different application of wearable tech, but I'd be grateful for any feedback from pioneers in the "movewear" space.

My resume is attached. Thank you for your consideration.

Sincerely,

Carl Kho

---

### **Template 2: Outreach to "Iyo" Project**

**Subject:** A Question on Audio Computing from an HCI Researcher

**Body:**

Hi Iyo Team,

Congratulations on graduating from X and building what you call the world's first true "audio computer." It's a fascinating engineering problem in signal processing and natural language.

*   **My Ambition:** I'm an AI researcher at Minerva, and my goal has long been to contribute to a moonshot factory. I articulated this plan two years ago in a video that ultimately secured the $95k in scholarships now funding my global studies: `https://youtu.be/q32UQJJX8S0?si=FMxADxSEdyvaLHNW&t=72` (20-second clip).

*   **My Ask:** To continue my self-driven education, would you be willing to sponsor a MasterClass certificate for me?

*   **My Current Work:** I'm currently building **Somach** (`https://somach.vercel.app/`), a gaming interface using biosensors (EMG/EEG) to translate noisy physiological data into clear user intent. I'd be grateful for any thoughts you might have on this approach to human-computer interaction.

My resume is attached for more detail. Thank you for your time.

Sincerely,

Carl Kho

---

### **Template 3: Outreach to "Mineral" Alumni**

**Subject:** Question from a Robotics Engineer Inspired by Mineral's Legacy

**Body:**

Hi [Contact Name],

I'm Carl Kho, a robotics and AI developer at Minerva. I was inspired by Mineral's journey from an X moonshot to its acquisition by John Deere, proving the viability of computational agriculture. Your work on the plant rovers, which combined robotics and machine perception to solve a real-world problem, is particularly impressive.

*   **My Ambition:** My own long-term goal is to build moonshot ideas at X. I laid out this plan two years ago in a video that I used to secure $95,050 in scholarships to fund my education: `https://youtu.be/q32UQJJX8S0?si=FMxADxSEdyvaLHNW&t=72` (20-second clip).

*   **My Ask:** As I continue to build my skills, would you or your team be willing to sponsor a MasterClass certificate for me?

*   **My Current Work:** I am currently developing **Somach** (`https://somach.vercel.app/`), a gaming interface that translates physical movement and biosensor data into game inputs. I would be grateful for any feedback you might have on the project's direction.

My resume is attached. Thank you for your consideration and for the inspiring work you did at Mineral.

Sincerely,

Carl Kho

Absolutely. Here are the next three templates, grounded in recent project news and crafted for brevity and impact.

---

### **Template 4: Outreach to "Waymo"**

**Background Research:** Waymo is no longer just a project but a full-fledged Alphabet company. They recently announced their first European expansion, with plans to launch a fully autonomous ride-hailing service in London in 2026. This involves tackling the notoriously complex and irregular road layouts of a city like London, a significant step up from the grid systems of many US cities.

**Subject:** A Question on Human-Vehicle Interaction from an AI Researcher

**Body:**

Hi Waymo Team,

I've been following your work for years, and your recent announcement to launch in London is a bold move. Tackling those irregular, medieval road layouts is a far more interesting challenge than another sunny day on a grid.

*   **My Ambition:** I'm an AI/Robotics researcher at Minerva with a long-term plan to build moonshot tech at X. I laid this out two years ago in a video I used to secure $95k in scholarships to fund my global education: `https://youtu.be/q32UQJJX8S0?si=FMxADxSEdyvaLHNW&t=72` (20-second clip).

*   **My Ask:** To keep learning, would you be willing to sponsor a MasterClass certificate for me?

*   **My Current Work:** I'm building **Somach** (`https://somach.vercel.app/`), a gaming interface using biosensors (EMG/EEG) to interpret human intent from noisy data. I'd be grateful for any feedback on it from a team that has mastered interpreting the chaotic "intent" of city traffic.

My resume is attached. Thank you for your time.

Sincerely,

Carl Kho

---

### **Template 5: Outreach to "Wing"**

**Background Research:** Wing is rapidly scaling its drone delivery services, partnering with Walmart for what they call the "world's largest drone delivery expansion." They are now completing thousands of deliveries weekly in areas like Dallas-Fort Worth, with an average delivery time under 19 minutes. This isn't a demo; it's a real, operational logistics network.

**Subject:** A Question on Autonomous Logistics from a Robotics Engineer

**Body:**

Hi Wing Team,

Your recent expansion with Walmart is impressive—moving from pilot projects to a logistics network completing thousands of weekly deliveries is the hard part of engineering that often gets overlooked.

*   **My Ambition:** I'm a robotics and AI developer at Minerva. My goal is to build moonshot technologies at X, a plan I articulated two years ago in the video that helped me secure $95k in scholarships to fund my education: `https://youtu.be/q32UQJJX8S0?si=FMxADxSEdyvaLHNW&t=72` (20-second clip).

*   **My Ask:** To support my continued learning, would you be willing to sponsor a MasterClass certificate for me?

*   **My Current Work:** I'm currently building **Somach** (`https://somach.vercel.app/`), an HCI project using biosensors for novel game control. It's an exploration into intuitive control for complex systems, and I'd be grateful for any feedback from a team that has mastered autonomous flight control in suburban backyards.

My resume is attached. Thanks for your consideration.

Sincerely,

Carl Kho

---

### **Template 6: Outreach to "Taara"**

**Background Research:** Project Taara is using Free Space Optical Communication (FSOC)—essentially fiber-optic internet without the cables—to bridge connectivity gaps. They have successfully deployed their technology in 13 countries, including providing a critical link over the Congo River and connecting communities in Kenya and India. In March 2025, Taara spun off from X to become an independent company.

**Subject:** A Question on Signal Integrity from an Aspiring Engineer

**Body:**

Hi Taara Team,

Your work is a brilliant example of "moonshot composting"—taking laser communication tech from the Loon project and applying it to solve last-mile connectivity on the ground. Your deployments in Kenya and across the Congo River are a testament to applying hard physics to solve tangible human problems.

*   **My Ambition:** I'm an AI researcher at Minerva with a long-term goal of working at X. I made this plan two years ago in a video that I used to secure the $95,050 in scholarships now funding my studies across seven countries: `https://youtu.be/q32UQJJX8S0?si=FMxADxSEdyvaLHNW&t=72` (20-second clip).

*   **My Ask:** As part of my continued education, would you be willing to sponsor a MasterClass certificate for me?

*   **My Current Work:** My capstone project, **Somach** (`https://somach.vercel.app/`), involves getting a clean signal (user intent) from a very noisy source (the human body) using biosensors. I'd be grateful for any feedback on my approach from a team that has mastered pulling a clean signal through miles of turbulent atmosphere.

My resume is attached. Thank you for your time and inspiring work.

Sincerely,

Carl Kho

### **Template 7: Outreach to "Intrinsic"**

**Background Research:** Intrinsic, now an Alphabet company, is building a software platform to make industrial robots easier to program and use. They recently acquired the Open Source Robotics Corporation (OSRC), the commercial arm of the organization behind ROS (Robot Operating System). Their goal is to move robotics from a code-heavy field to a more accessible, AI-driven one.

**Subject:** A Question on Robot Intelligence from a ROS user

**Body:**

Hi Intrinsic Team,

Your acquisition of OSRC was a significant move—doubling down on the ROS ecosystem to build an intelligence layer for industrial robots is a fascinating and pragmatic approach to democratizing robotics.

*   **My Ambition:** I'm a robotics developer at Minerva University. My long-term plan is to build moonshot-scale technologies, a goal I articulated in this video two years ago, which helped me secure $95,050 in scholarships for my global education: `https://youtu.be/q32UQJJX8S0?si=FMxADxSEdyvaLHNW&t=72` (20-second clip).

*   **My Ask:** To help me continue learning, would you be willing to sponsor a MasterClass certificate for me?

*   **My Current Work:** I'm currently building **Somach** (`https://somach.vercel.app/`), an HCI project that uses biosensors to create intuitive, physical game controllers. I'd be grateful for any feedback on it from a team dedicated to making human-robot interaction more seamless.

My resume is attached. Thank you for your work in advancing the field.

Sincerely,

Carl Kho

---

### **Template 8: Outreach to "Tidal"**

**Background Research:** Tidal is using AI-powered underwater perception technology to monitor fish populations in fish farms. Their goal is to make aquaculture more sustainable by giving farmers unprecedented visibility into the health and behavior of their stock. They've deployed their camera systems in salmon farms in Norway and with other partners globally.

**Subject:** A Question on Underwater Perception from a Fellow Data-Wrangler

**Body:**

Hi Tidal Team,

Your work in applying computer vision to the notoriously difficult environment of open-ocean fish farms is brilliant. Getting a clean signal from that "blizzard of fish scales and poop" is a signal processing challenge I can appreciate.

*   **My Ambition:** I'm an AI researcher at Minerva. My goal is to build moonshot technologies at X, a plan I outlined in a video two years ago that was instrumental in securing $95k in scholarships for my education: `https://youtu.be/q32UQJJX8S0?si=FMxADxSEdyvaLHNW&t=72` (20-second clip).

*   **My Ask:** As part of my ongoing learning, would you be willing to sponsor a MasterClass certificate for me?

*   **My Current Work:** I'm building **Somach** (`https://somach.vercel.app/`), which uses biosensors (EMG/EEG) to interpret human intent from noisy biological signals. I'd value any feedback on it from a team that has mastered pulling insight from the chaotic data of the ocean.

My resume is attached. Thank you for your time.

Sincerely,

Carl Kho

---

### **Template 9: Outreach to "Bellwether"**

**Background Research:** Bellwether is an early-stage project within X focused on using AI and vast datasets to create highly accurate, long-range forecasts of extreme weather events. The goal is to predict the path and intensity of things like wildfires or hurricanes with enough lead time to make a difference in emergency response.

**Subject:** A Question on Predictive Modeling from a Future Engineer

**Body:**

Hi Bellwether Team,

Your mission to use AI for long-range, accurate forecasting of extreme weather is one of the most critical moonshots I can imagine. Moving from reactive to predictive emergency response is a massive, data-intensive challenge.

*   **My Ambition:** I'm an AI developer at Minerva University with a long-term goal of building technologies at X. I articulated this plan two years ago in a video that helped me secure the $95,050 in scholarships that fund my studies: `https://youtu.be/q32UQJJX8S0?si=FMxADxSEdyvaLHNW&t=72` (20-second clip).

*   **My Ask:** To help me build the skills needed to tackle such problems, would you be willing to sponsor a MasterClass certificate for me?

*   **My Current Work:** My capstone is **Somach** (`https://somach.vercel.app/`), a system that tries to *predict* a user's intended action from complex, chaotic biosensor data. I would be grateful for any feedback from a team that specializes in finding predictable patterns in large-scale chaotic systems.

My resume is attached. Thank you for your consideration.

Sincerely,

Carl Kho

**Subject:** A Question on Home Energy from a Future Engineer

**Body:**

Hi Dandelion Team,

Congratulations on your recent Series B1 funding—it’s great to see a moonshot focused on a problem as unglamorous and essential as home heating successfully scale. Your work is a masterclass in practical application.

*   **My Ambition:** I'm an AI/robotics researcher at Minerva University. My long-term goal is to build technologies at a place like X, a plan I outlined two years ago in the video that helped secure the $95,050 in scholarships that fund my education: `https://youtu.be/q32UQJJX8S0?si=FMxADxSEdyvaLHNW&t=72` (20-second clip).

### **Template 11: Outreach to "Malta Inc."**

**Background Research:** Malta Inc. graduated from X to commercialize its long-duration energy storage system, which stores energy in molten salt. They have since formed a strategic partnership with Siemens Energy and are deploying their first commercial-scale system, tackling the critical problem of grid stability for renewable energy sources.

**Subject:** A Question on Grid-Scale Storage from a Student Engineer

**Body:**

Hi Malta Team,

I've been following your progress since graduating from X, and your recent partnership with Siemens Energy to deploy your first commercial molten salt system is a huge milestone. Solving long-duration energy storage is one of the hardest and most important problems for a sustainable grid.

*   **My Ambition:** I'm an AI researcher at Minerva. My goal is to build moonshot-scale technologies, a plan I articulated two years ago in a video that was instrumental in securing $95k in scholarships for my global education: `https://youtu.be/q32UQJJX8S0?si=FMxADxSEdyvaLHNW&t=72` (20-second clip).

*   **My Ask:** As part of my continued learning, would you be willing to sponsor a MasterClass certificate for me?

*   **My Current Work:** I'm building **Somach** (`https://somach.vercel.app/`), a system that translates noisy, chaotic biosensor data into stable, intentional control signals. I would value any feedback on it from a team that has mastered maintaining stability in complex, grid-scale thermal energy systems.

My resume is attached. Thank you for your time and for tackling such a critical challenge.

Sincerely,

Carl Kho

### **Template 12: Outreach to "Chronicle" (at Google Cloud)**

**Background Research:** Chronicle, a cybersecurity moonshot, was absorbed into Google Cloud and is now the foundation of "Chronicle Security Operations." Its core premise remains: apply Google-scale data analysis to petabytes of security telemetry to find threats that other systems miss. It’s a classic signal-from-noise problem.

**Subject:** A Question on Signal Detection from an AI Researcher

**Body:**

Hi Chronicle Team at Google Cloud,

I’m a student of X's history, and Chronicle's journey from a moonshot to the core of Google's security analytics is a fascinating case study. The original premise—finding the threat "needle" in a petabyte-scale "haystack"—is the ultimate signal-from-noise problem.

*   **My Ambition:** I'm an AI developer at Minerva. My long-term goal is to build technologies at X, a plan I detailed in this video two years ago, which helped secure the $95,050 in scholarships now funding my education: `https://youtu.be/q32UQJJX8S0?si=FMxADxSEdyvaLHNW&t=72` (20-second clip).

*   **My Ask:** To help build my skills in data analysis, would you be willing to sponsor a MasterClass certificate for me?

*   **My Current Work:** I’m currently building **Somach** (`https://somach.vercel.app/`), a project that attempts to do something similar at a biological scale: find the "signal" of user intent within the "noise" of EMG and EEG data. I’d be grateful for any feedback on my approach.

My resume is attached. Thank you for your consideration.

Sincerely,

Carl Kho

### **Template 13: Outreach to "Loon" Alumni**

**Background Research:** Project Loon was a high-profile moonshot that aimed to provide internet access via high-altitude balloons. While the project was wound down in 2021, its key technological breakthroughs, particularly in Free Space Optical Communication (FSOC), were "composted" and became the foundation for Project Taara. Its legacy is one of ambitious engineering and valuable technological inheritance.

**Subject:** A Question from a Student Inspired by Loon's Engineering Legacy

**Body:**

Hi [Contact Name],

I'm an engineering student at Minerva and have been studying the history of X's projects. While Loon may have wound down, its engineering legacy—especially the optical communication technology that now powers Taara—is a powerful lesson in "moonshot composting."

*   **My Ambition:** My own long-term goal is to build technologies at X. I articulated this plan two years ago in a video that was instrumental in securing the $95,050 in scholarships that now fund my global education: `https://youtu.be/q32UQJJX8S0?si=FMxADxSEdyvaLHNW&t=72` (20-second clip).

*   **My Ask:** To support my continued education, would you be willing to sponsor a MasterClass certificate for me?

*   **My Current Work:** My capstone project, **Somach** (`https://somach.vercel.app/`), involves creating a stable control system from chaotic, real-world data (biosensors). I would be grateful for any feedback from someone who worked on maintaining stable communication links from the chaos of the stratosphere.

My resume is attached. Thank you for your time and for the inspiring work you did on such an ambitious project.

Sincerely,

Carl Kho

---

### **Template 14: Outreach to "Makani" Alumni**

**Background Research:** Makani, another graduated and later sunsetted project, developed energy kites to generate wind power. Like Loon, its mission was ambitious. After being wound down by Alphabet, its patents were open-sourced, and its key findings were released in a comprehensive report and documentary, "Pulling Power from the Sky," to benefit the broader airborne wind energy community.

**Subject:** A Question re: Makani's Open-Sourced Legacy

**Body:**

Hi [Contact Name],

I'm an AI and robotics researcher at Minerva University. I recently watched the "Pulling Power from the Sky" documentary and was incredibly impressed not just by Makani's technology, but by the decision to open-source the project's learnings after it was wound down. That's a true commitment to advancing the field.

*   **My Ambition:** My long-term goal is to build moonshot technologies at X. I outlined this plan two years ago in a video that helped me secure the $95k in scholarships now funding my education: `https://youtu.be/q32UQJJX8S0?si=FMxADxSEdyvaLHNW&t=72` (20-second clip).

*   **My Ask:** To help me build the skills needed for such work, would you be willing to sponsor a MasterClass certificate for me?

*   **My Current Work:** I'm building **Somach** (`https://somach.vercel.app/`), a project that uses biosensors to create intuitive controllers for complex systems. I'd value any feedback from someone who worked on the immense challenge of controlling an autonomous kite in high-altitude winds.

My resume is attached. Thank you for your consideration and for contributing to the open-source community.

Sincerely,

Carl Kho

---

### **Template 15: Outreach to "Foghorn" Alumni**

**Background Research:** Project Foghorn was a moonshot aimed at creating a carbon-neutral fuel from seawater. It involved developing a novel reactor to combine hydrogen and carbon dioxide from seawater into a synthetic natural gas. While the project was eventually stopped because it was not projected to be cost-competitive with other clean energy solutions, it represented a bold attempt at fundamental chemistry and engineering.

**Subject:** A Question Inspired by Project Foghorn's Ambition

**Body:**

Hi [Contact Name],

I'm a student engineer at Minerva and have been researching some of X's past moonshots. Project Foghorn's goal of creating a carbon-neutral fuel from seawater was one of the most ambitious I've come across—a true attempt to solve a problem at the level of fundamental chemistry.

*   **My Ambition:** My own long-term goal is to build world-changing technologies at X. I articulated this plan two years ago in a video that was instrumental in securing the $95,050 in scholarships that now fund my education across seven countries: `https://youtu.be/q32UQJJX8S0?si=FMxADxSEdyvaLHNW&t=72` (20-second clip).

*   **My Ask:** To help me gain the interdisciplinary skills for such work, would you be willing to sponsor a MasterClass certificate for me?

*   **My Current Work:** I am currently developing **Somach** (`https://somach.vercel.app/`), a project that explores new ways for humans to interact with complex systems using biosensors. I would be grateful for any feedback on it from someone who has experience tackling incredibly difficult, first-principles engineering challenges.

My resume is attached. Thank you for your time and for the inspiring work you undertook.

Sincerely,

Carl Kho

### **Template 16: Outreach to "A Life"**

**Background Research:** "A-Life" is one of X's newest public-facing moonshots, announced in September 2025. Its mission is to create a dedicated AI platform for biology, aiming to accelerate the process of engineering cells into "living factories" for everything from medicines to materials. It's a direct application of systems thinking and AI to the messy, non-linear world of biomanufacturing.

**Subject:** A Question on "Biologic Systems Intelligence" from a Cog-Sci Minor

**Body:**

Hi A-Life Team,

I was thrilled to see the announcement for A-Life. The mission to build an AI platform "from the ground up, following biology's messy, dynamic rules" is exactly the kind of deep, interdisciplinary problem that inspires me.

*   **My Ambition:** I'm an AI developer and Cognition/Neuropsychology minor at Minerva. My goal is to work at X, a plan I outlined two years ago in a video that helped secure the $95k in scholarships funding my education: `https://youtu.be/q32UQJJX8S0?si=FMxADxSEdyvaLHNW&t=72` (20-second clip).

*   **My Ask:** To help me build the skills for this path, would you consider sponsoring a MasterClass certificate for me?

*   **My Current Work:** My capstone, **Somach** (`https://somach.vercel.app/`), is a hands-on exploration of the same core problem you're solving—interpreting messy biological systems. I'm using biosensors (EMG/EEG) to translate human physiological signals into control inputs. I'd be grateful for any feedback from a team that is pioneering AI for biology.

My resume is attached. Thank you for tackling such a foundational challenge.

Sincerely,

Carl Kho

---

### **Template 17: Outreach to "Materra"**

**Background Research:** Materra is a moonshot focused on the circular economy, starting with plastics. They are developing technology that uses sensor fusion and AI to identify materials at a molecular level, aiming to create a dataset that can radically improve sorting and recycling. Their pilot project at a recycling plant scans and identifies thousands of items per minute.

**Subject:** A Question on Molecular-Level Sorting from an AI Developer

**Body:**

Hi Materra Team,

Your work on creating a molecular-level "dataset for waste" is a brilliant, first-principles approach to the circular economy. Most focus on the end of the recycling pipeline; you're fixing the data problem at the very beginning.

*   **My Ambition:** I'm an AI/robotics developer at Minerva University. My long-term goal is to build technologies at X, a plan I articulated in this video two years ago, which was instrumental in securing $95,050 in scholarships for my education: `https://youtu.be/q32UQJJX8S0?si=FMxADxSEdyvaLHNW&t=72` (20-second clip).

*   **My Ask:** To help accelerate my learning in sensor fusion and data analysis, would you be willing to sponsor a MasterClass certificate for me?

*   **My Current Work:** My capstone project, **Somach** (`https://somach.vercel.app/`), involves using sensor fusion (EMG, EEG, IMU) to derive a clean "intent" signal from a noisy source (the human body). I would be grateful for any feedback from a team that has mastered identifying material composition from complex sensor data.

My resume is attached. Thank you for your consideration.

Sincerely,

Carl Kho

---

### **Template 18: Outreach to "Tapestry"**

**Background Research:** Tapestry is X's moonshot for the electric grid, building what they call a "Google Maps for electrons." They use AI to create a unified digital model of the grid, helping operators plan for the future (Grid Planning Tool) and manage the present (GridAware). They have active partnerships in New Zealand, Chile, and with PJM in the U.S.

**Subject:** A Question on Grid Visibility from a Systems Engineer

**Body:**

Hi Tapestry Team,

Your mission to make the electric grid visible is a fantastic example of a moonshot that's both ambitious and deeply pragmatic. The "GridAware" tool, in particular—using AI to cut inspection times from 45 minutes to 5—is a testament to solving real-world operational bottlenecks.

*   **My Ambition:** I'm an AI developer at Minerva. My goal is to build large-scale systems at X, a plan I outlined in a video two years ago that helped me secure the $95k in scholarships now funding my global education: `https://youtu.be/q32UQJJX8S0?si=FMxADxSEdyvaLHNW&t=72` (20-second clip).

*   **My Ask:** To help me learn more about managing complex systems, would you be willing to sponsor a MasterClass certificate for me?

*   **My Current Work:** I'm building **Somach** (`https://somach.vercel.app/`), a project focused on creating a stable and intuitive control system from the highly variable and chaotic data streams of the human nervous system. I would value any feedback from a team that has mastered weaving together trillions of data points to model an entire continent's power grid.

My resume is attached. Thank you for your time.

Sincerely,

Carl Kho

### **Template 16: Outreach to "A Life"**
**Background Research:** "A-Life" is one of X's newest public-facing moonshots, announced in September
2025. Its mission is to create a dedicated AI platform for biology, aiming to accelerate the process of engineering cells
into "living factories" for everything from medicines to materials. It's a direct application of systems thinking and AI to the

messy, non-linear world of biomanufacturing.

**Subject:** A Question on "Biologic Systems Intelligence

" from a Cog-Sci Minor

**Body:**

Hi A-Life Team,

I was thrilled to see
the announcement for A-Life. The mission to build an AI platform "from the ground up, following biology's messy

, dynamic rules" is exactly the kind of deep, interdisciplinary problem that inspires me.

*   **My Ambition:** I
'm an AI developer and Cognition/Neuropsychology minor at Minerva. My goal is to work at X,
a plan I outlined two years ago in a video that helped secure the $95k in scholarships funding my education:
`https://youtu.be/q32UQJJX8S0?si=FMxADxSEdy

vaLHNW&t=72` (20-second clip).

*   **My Ask:** To

help me build the skills for this path, would you consider sponsoring a MasterClass certificate for me?

*   **My
Current Work:** My capstone, **Somach** (`https://somach.vercel.app/`), is a
hands-on exploration of the same core problem you're solving—interpreting messy biological systems. I'm using
biosensors (EMG/EEG) to translate human physiological signals into control inputs. I'd be grateful for any feedback from

a team that is pioneering AI for biology.

My resume is attached. Thank you for tackling such a foundational challenge.

Sincerely

,

Carl Kho

---

### **Template 17: Outreach to "Materra"**

**Background Research:** Mater
ra is a moonshot focused on the circular economy, starting with plastics. They are developing technology that uses sensor fusion and AI to identify
materials at a molecular level, aiming to create a dataset that can radically improve sorting and recycling. Their pilot project at a recycling

plant scans and identifies thousands of items per minute.

**Subject:** A Question on Molecular-Level Sorting from an AI Developer

**Body:**

Hi Materra Team,

Your work on creating a molecular-level "dataset for waste" is a
brilliant, first-principles approach to the circular economy. Most focus on the end of the recycling pipeline; you're fixing

the data problem at the very beginning.

*   **My Ambition:** I'm an AI/robotics developer at
Minerva University. My long-term goal is to build technologies at X, a plan I articulated in this video two years ago
, which was instrumental in securing $95,050 in scholarships for my education: `https://youtu.be/
q32UQJJX8S0?si=FMxADxSEdyvaLHNW&t

=72` (20-second clip).

*   **My Ask:** To help accelerate my learning in sensor

fusion and data analysis, would you be willing to sponsor a MasterClass certificate for me?

*   **My Current
Work:** My capstone project, **Somach** (`https://somach.vercel.app/`), involves using sensor fusion (
EMG, EEG, IMU) to derive a clean "intent" signal from a noisy source (the human body). I

would be grateful for any feedback from a team that has mastered identifying material composition from complex sensor data.

My resume is attached

. Thank you for your consideration.

Sincerely,

Carl Kho

---

### **Template 18: Outreach to "

Tapestry"**

**Background Research:** Tapestry is X's moonshot for the electric grid, building
what they call a "Google Maps for electrons." They use AI to create a unified digital model of the grid, helping
operators plan for the future (Grid Planning Tool) and manage the present (GridAware). They have active partnerships in New

Zealand, Chile, and with PJM in the U.S.

**Subject:** A Question on Grid Visibility from a Systems

Engineer

**Body:**

Hi Tapestry Team,

Your mission to make the electric grid visible is a fantastic example
of a moonshot that's both ambitious and deeply pragmatic. The "GridAware" tool, in particular—using AI to cut

inspection times from 45 minutes to 5—is a testament to solving real-world operational bottlenecks.

*
**My Ambition:** I'm an AI developer at Minerva. My goal is to build large-scale systems at
X, a plan I outlined in a video two years ago that helped me secure the $95k in scholarships now funding my
global education: `https://youtu.be/q32UQJJX8S0?si=FMxAD

xSEdyvaLHNW&t=72` (20-second clip).

*   **
My Ask:** To help me learn more about managing complex systems, would you be willing to sponsor a MasterClass certificate for me?
*   **My Current Work:** I'm building **Somach** (`https://somach.vercel.app
/`), a project focused on creating a stable and intuitive control system from the highly variable and chaotic data streams of the human nervous
system. I would value any feedback from a team that has mastered weaving together trillions of data points to model an entire continent

's power grid.

My resume is attached. Thank you for your time.

Sincerely,

Carl Kho

### **Template 19: Outreach to "280 Earth"**

**Background Research:** 280 Earth, which graduated from X to become an independent company, is focused on "heat-to-power" technology. They are pioneering closed-loop geothermal systems and have a significant focus on Direct Air Capture (DAC) of CO2. Their core innovation involves using waste heat from industrial processes to power their DAC systems, dramatically lowering the energy cost and making carbon capture more economically viable.

**Subject:** A Question on Thermal Systems from a Student Engineer

**Body:**

Hi 280 Earth Team,

Your approach to Direct Air Capture is incredibly pragmatic. Using industrial waste heat to power the process, turning a thermal liability into a carbon-capture asset, is a brilliant piece of systems engineering.

*   **My Ambition:** I'm an AI/robotics researcher at Minerva University. My long-term plan is to build moonshot technologies, a goal I articulated in this video two years ago which was key to securing $95k in scholarships for my education: `https://youtu.be/q32UQJJX8S0?si=FMxADxSEdyvaLHNW&t=72` (20-second clip).

*   **My Ask:** To help me build the interdisciplinary skills for such work, would you consider sponsoring a MasterClass certificate for me?

*   **My Current Work:** My capstone, **Somach** (`https://somach.vercel.app/`), involves managing the "waste heat" of the nervous system—filtering noisy, unintended biological signals to capture a clean control input. I'd be grateful for any feedback from a team that has mastered harnessing complex thermal dynamics for a productive purpose.

My resume is attached. Thank you for your consideration.

Sincerely,

Carl Kho

---

### **Template 20: Outreach to "H2E" Alumni**

**Background Research:** Project H2E (Hydrogen to Energy) was an early-stage X moonshot focused on developing a more efficient and affordable way to store and transport hydrogen for use in fuel cell vehicles. While the project is no longer active, its core challenge was tackling the immense systems-level problem of creating a viable, nationwide hydrogen infrastructure.

**Subject:** A Question re: H2E's Systems Challenge

**Body:**

Hi [Contact Name],

I'm a student engineer at Minerva and have been researching X's portfolio of energy moonshots. H2E's goal of building a viable hydrogen infrastructure was one of the most ambitious systems-level challenges I've seen.

*   **My Ambition:** My own long-term goal is to work on these kinds of large-scale engineering problems at X. I outlined this plan two years ago in a video that helped me secure the $95k in scholarships now funding my global education: `https://youtu.be/q32UQJJX8S0?si=FMxADxSEdyvaLHNW&t=72` (20-second clip).

*   **My Ask:** To support my continued education in systems engineering, would you be willing to sponsor a MasterClass certificate for me?

*   **My Current Work:** My capstone, **Somach** (`https://somach.vercel.app/`), is a microcosm of a systems problem: integrating multiple noisy data streams (EMG/EEG/IMU) into a single, coherent output. I would value any feedback on it from someone who worked on the immense challenge of designing a nationwide energy infrastructure.

My resume is attached. Thank you for your time and for the inspiring work you did on such a foundational problem.

Sincerely,

Carl Kho

---

### **Template 21: Outreach to "AIDA"**

**Background Research:** AIDA is a moonshot within X focused on using AI to augment human creativity, starting with music. Their goal is not to replace artists but to build "co-creative tools" that act as sparring partners. They developed MusicLM at Google and are exploring how large language models can be adapted to understand and generate music, helping artists break creative blocks.

**Subject:** A Question on Co-Creative AI from a Fellow Builder

**Body:**

Hi AIDA Team,

Your mission to build "co-creative AI tools" is a refreshing and nuanced take on generative AI. The concept of AI as a creative sparring partner, rather than a replacement for artists, is a much more interesting future to build.

*   **My Ambition:** I'm an AI developer at Minerva University. My long-term goal is to build new forms of human-computer interaction at X, a plan I articulated in this video two years ago that helped me secure $95,050 in scholarships: `https://youtu.be/q32UQJJX8S0?si=FMxADxSEdyvaLHNW&t=72` (20-second clip).

*   **My Ask:** To help me learn more about the intersection of technology and creativity, would you be willing to sponsor a MasterClass certificate for me?

*   **My Current Work:** I'm building **Somach** (`https://somach.vercel.app/`), a project that explores a different kind of co-creative partnership. It uses biosensors to let a user's physical body "collaborate" with a game in real-time. I would be grateful for any feedback from a team that is pioneering new ways for humans and AI to create together.

My resume is attached. Thank you for your consideration.

Sincerely,

Carl Kho
